record.attribute: TriTrypDB is an integrated genomic and functional genomic database for pathogens of the family Trypanosomatidae, including organisms in both Leishmania and Trypanosoma genera. TriTrypDB and its continued development are possible through the collaborative efforts between EuPathDB, GeneDB and colleagues at the Seattle Biomedical Research Institute (SBRI).

Funding for TriTrypDB development and enhanced annotation of kinetoplastid parasites is provided by coordinated grants from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and the Wellcome Trust.
TriTrypDB joins the family of pathogen-databases that are housed under the NIAID-funded EuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC) umbrella. The EuPathDB team is mainly distributed between the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and the University of Georgia in Athens, Georgia.

TriTrypDB integrates multiple genomic-scale data types in a manner that enables the database user to computationally ask biologically relevant questions. Data may be accessed by interrogating TriTrypDB using any of the multiple available questions -- Please visit our tutorial and FAQ sections for more information.

Please use the following URL when referring to TriTrypDB: http://TriTrypDB.org

Also, the following reference can be used to cite EuPathDB resources:

Aurrecoechea, C., M. Heiges, H. Wang, Z. Wang, S. Fischer, P. Rhodes, J. Miller, E. Kraemer, C. J. Stoeckert, Jr., D. S. Roos, and J. C. Kissinger. 2007. ApiDB: integrated resources for the apicomplexan bioinformatics resource center. Nucleic Acids Research 35:D427-30. (PMID 17098930).
We are interested in including documents and protocols that are useful for the TriTryp community. Please send us your suggestions by clicking here.
